intro: Strophostyles leiosperma, commonly known as the smooth-fruited strophostyle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a small, smooth, dry capsule that splits open to release seeds. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is often found in forest understories.
